I'm unable to see past the lack of conspiracy raising precision as I react against the banal and vapid NyPost article that has little bearing on reality. Comment: That was actually the origin of NCR. The vault for Shady Sands was filled up with a bunch of racially diverse and religiously divergent people out of the assumption they'd tear each other apart. Author: CT_Phipps-Author

Comment: >There are thousands of miles of tunnels beneath the continental United States...  This is because TBM's are a thing.  There are also thousands of miles outside of the Continental US. There is such extreme agreement here, you shouldn't have even bothered noting it.  >Abandoned subway systems, unused service routes, and deserted mine shafts...  Yup. You can increase your number when you include utility and other non-human use tunnels such as for water and sewage transport.  >Many have no known purpose at all.  How do you know this? You are pulling an idea out of thin air and doing backhanded conspiracy mongering.   Are you able to add any value to the preposterous idea that trillions of dollars have been spent on secret cities for the rich and powerful with some under the sea?  Or are you just lazily and mindlessly reacting to my comments without having even read the NyPost article?  That is, what is your point and why is it devoid of specifics?
